alert.note: Alert for Allegany (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 23 at 6:15PM EDT until July 23 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...NORTHEASTERN ALLEGANY...NORTHEASTERN MORGAN AND NORTHWESTERN BERKELEY COUNTIES... At 614 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Berkeley Springs, or near Hancock, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Hancock, Berkeley Springs, Great Cacapon, Pecktonville, Johnsons Mill, Cherry Run, Lineburg, Valley View, Fishers Bridge, Spohrs Crossroads, Spruce Pine Hollow, Rock Gap, Forest Park, Bellegrove, Smith Crossroads, Berryville, New Hope, Sleepy Creek and Shady Grove. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
